titleStmt.title: J. C. Randolph, S. Noland, and W. Brown to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1697

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Nicholasville Ky. Oct 22d 1863.
Govr Thomas. E. Bramlette.
Sir.

The undersigned citizens of Ky respectfully petition your excellency to appoint John. T. Bronaugh a "Notary Public" for the county of Jessamine The time of W. R. Welch has expired and we desire the vacancy thus created to be filled at once by Mr. Bronaugh and hope his appointment will be confirmed by the Senate at the next meeting of the General Assembly. Mr. Bronaugh is a firm Union man and every way qualified to discharge to duties of the office.

Yours. Most. Respectfully.
J. C. Randolph
Asst. U.S. Assessor
Jes. Co. & Woodford
S. Noland
W. Brown.

Jessamine Co
N. P.
J. S. Bronaugh
Comd.
31st Oct/63
